user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_init_mem_pools_:
```c
void
MHD_init_mem_pools_ (void)
{
#ifdef MHD_SC_PAGESIZE
  long result;
  result = sysconf (MHD_SC_PAGESIZE);
  if (-1 != result)
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) result;
  else
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#elif defined(_WIN32)
  SYSTEM_INFO si;
  GetSystemInfo (&si);
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) si.dwPageSize;
#else
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#endif /* _WIN32 */
  mhd_assert (0 == (MHD_sys_page_size_ % ALIGN_SIZE));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_init_mem_pools_:
#define MHD_SC_PAGESIZE _SC_PAGE_SIZE
...
static size_t MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t)
#if defined(MHD_USE_PAGESIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGESIZE;
#elif defined(MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGE_SIZE;
#else  /* ! MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC */
                                   _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_ _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define ALIGN_SIZE (2*sizeof(void*))
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No suspicious fragments found. Reasoning:
- The function MHD_init_mem_pools_ has no parameters (void), so MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 (a function parameter should not be modified) cannot be violated within this function.
- The only local variable modified is result (assigned from sysconf) and the global MHD_sys_page_size_ (assigned from result, constants, or si.dwPageSize). These are not function parameters.
- sysconf is called with a value argument (macro expanding to an integer constant); passing by value cannot result in modification of a caller parameter.
- GetSystemInfo(&si) passes the address of a local variable; modifying the object pointed-to is allowed by the rule (the rule forbids modifying the pointer parameter itself, not the pointed-to object). The address expression &si is not a function parameter of MHD_init_mem_pools_.
- The mhd_assert(ignore) macro discards its parameter and expands to ((void)0), so it does not modify any function parameter.
- Macros and constant assignments (MHD_SC_PAGESIZE, MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_, ALIGN_SIZE, etc.) do not introduce parameter modification.
Therefore, there are no code fragments in the provided function that require investigation for Rule 17.8.
